ai-tha-ap375:0.3_0: The Elders having given a yellow cloth to the Elder Nun Pālikāsa
ai-tha-ap375:1.1_0: “One from the bank of the river,
ai-tha-ap375:2.2_0: Like a freshly blossoming sal tree
ai-tha-ap375:2.4_0: And after seeing (him), I am happy with my mind,
ai-tha-ap375:3.1_0: joyful intent on what is beneficial,
ai-tha-ap375:3.3_0: Three flowers arise in the Three flowers.
ai-tha-ap375:5.1_0: if the upper story is walking on a hut;
ai-tha-ap375:5.4_0: I had reached the end of life.
ai-tha-ap375:6.3_0: having given up birth and old age,
ai-tha-ap375:6.4_0: I went to the realm of the Thirty-Three.
ai-tha-ap375:7.1_0: he saw the three hundred and seventy-seven limbs,
ai-tha-ap375:7.2_0: acting as ruler of the gods.
ai-tha-ap375:8.1_0: On the two occasions when the other goes forth
ai-tha-ap375:8.2_0: As a bird was worshipped by the flowers,
ai-tha-ap375:8.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap375:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Palacelace.
ai-tha-ap375:11.1_0: Third was the third Elder Nun Uppalavaṇṇā.
